tweets.text:
In celebration of the WORLD ENVIRONMENT DAY, here is the official trailer of my short film "The Jar" which depicts the global issues of climate change crises and drought. 
#EnvironmentDay 
#environment 
#EnvironmentDay2020 
#ClimateChange 
#ClimateCrisis 
#ClimateAction https://t.co/RtZx981CAe
For more information, you can read the full report here: https://t.co/NhV1ZQTz4S https://t.co/hvNCnON4n4

Join us at 10 am this morning to hear about the impacts and danger of flood water, explore flooding from a child's perspective and talk to some of our experts. 
https://t.co/0Qjf5Gkt9O @DrJRumary @johncurtinEA @MoretonBack1 @KateMarksEA @LearnLiveUK @EnvAgency

Looking for a UK expert on flooding who’s a great public speaker. Possibly someone from @EnvAgency or an academic. 
@perry_jims
Great to hear a shout out to @YorksWildlife @WildlifeTrusts as part of #WHYClimateSummit2020 @WYHpartnership and the @EnvAgencyYNE presentation. https://t.co/ksXowUYrLi

Pennywort can be a massive problem for watercourses without intervention. Can you help? We are working in partnership with @River_Care and @EnvAgencyMids to enable river users to help us spot, record, map and treat pennywort in the Witham Catchment. https://t.co/iWxHURoOfw

Join our virtual public meeting with @networkrail
on Thursday 7.30pm by zoom to find out about the next stage of our repairs to Shade Chapel culvert in #Todmorden & work to GauxholmeViaduct. 

We're working hard to minimise disruption to residents
#flooding #HaveYourSay https://t.co/6onogTwizV

Help Callum will feature as part of the @EnvAgency Learn Live session on Flood Risk and Resilience from 10am this morning. Watch along here https://t.co/jXjBN8BpsD https://t.co/dtTMbir57R

Here's our Fisheries Enforcement Officers showing Police Forces in the #NorthWest the various illegal instruments used by poachers for the illegal taking of salmonids and coarse fish.

This partnership work is carried out twice a year with various Police Forces.

#fish https://t.co/hlxA2fbkML

At 4am on Sunday officers were out closing flood gates to protect Kings Lynn from high tides and potential flooding. 

Our Area Director, Simon Hawkins, Lady Roberts and @jamesowild visited to see the hard work that goes into protecting the town👍 #Norfolk #flood https://t.co/Z2lMZrzkqL
High spring tide at King’s Lynn this morning. Thanks to @EnvAgency for keeping an eye on the situation! https://t.co/xueTKhoAdu

Great to get together with partners @SoTCityCouncil & @EnvAgencyMids to update on the progress of this major urban conservation project. A complete transformation of the River Trent for wildlife & people at the old Victoria Ground. More news coming soon on our @WildStoke feed! https://t.co/PMeD7x6C5b

Works on Phase 1 of the #Carlisle flood risk management scheme continue to progress well with new pedestrian footpaths being installed in Melbourne Park and wall raising continuing downstream of Botcherby Bridge. https://t.co/g9PRzARLuE
Thank you to our Somerset Prepared partners for supporting the partnership and the Somerset Prepared Virtual Event 2020 https://t.co/6db3gXBD6q #Somerset #preparedness

Don't flush kitchen roll down the loo - it doesn't dissolve the same way as toilet paper.

Flushing it down the loo damages your pipes and can cause flooding.

To protect our environment, always put kitchen roll in the bin.

#Unblocktober https://t.co/ViFB8LlgM4

No. 8 of 10 spoil heaps we're tackling this year. Toxic chemicals from this mound wash into the river nr #Nenthead and are carried all the way downstream and out to sea at #Tynemouth.
